Uses of Interface
com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.Expression

  • Packages that use Expression 
    Package Description
    com.stephengware.java.ai.planning
    Contains objects for representing planning problems, planning algorithms, and plans.
    com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic
    Contains objects for representing logical formulas.

      Subinterfaces of Expression in com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Literal
      A literal is an atomic expression (i.e.
      Classes in com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic that implement Expression 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BooleanExpression
      A boolean expression is an expression composed of other expressions and combined according to certain rules.
      class  Conjunction
      A conjunction is a Boolean expression that is true when all of its conjuncts are true.
      class  Disjunction
      A disjunction is a Boolean expression that is true when any of its disjuncts are true.
      class  ExpressionObject
      An implementation of Expression which provides a default implementation of Object.equals(Object).
      class  NAryBooleanExpression
      The parent class of all Boolean expressions with an arbitrary number of arguments.
      class  NegatedLiteral
      The negation of a literal is a literal.
      class  Negation
      A negation is a Boolean expression which represents the opposite of some expression.
      class  Predication
      Represents a single statement in function-free predicate logic.

      protected Expression[] NAryBooleanExpression.flatten()
